title: Amnesia, nostalgia, healing: Spain grapples with Franco legacy 50 years on
summary: Half a century has passed since Franco's dictatorship ended with his death, but some in Spain still valorise his rule.

title: Russian air strikes kill 26 in devastating attack on Ukraine’s Ternopil
summary: Residents gather below the wreckage, anxiously awaiting news about loved ones unaccounted for after the aerial assault.

title: Uncovering mining scars in the Amazon
summary: Al Jazeera’s Monica Yanakiew takes us inside the Amazon rainforest, where mining scars are impossible to ignore.

title: China’s EVs dominate the world — why not in the US and Canada?
summary: China makes more than 70 percent of the world's electric cars. But it's hard to find those vehicles in North America.

title: Chinese woman who became Philippines mayor gets life for human trafficking
summary: Alice Guo, who lied about her identity, recruited foreign nationals to carry out online scams, say prosecutors.

title: South Africa beefs up security on streets, bracing for G20 summit protests
summary: More than 3,500 police officers deployed as South Africa braces for protests during the G20 summit this weekend.

title: Detente? Trump says Mamdani will visit White House on Friday
summary: After months of trading public barbs, the US president and New York City mayor-elect are set to meet in person.

title: LIVE: Israel attacks southern Gaza, kills at least 4 Palestinians
summary: The air attacks near the city of Khan Younis come a day after Israel killed 30 people across Gaza.

title: The Kenyan woman confronting cancer stigma with knitted breast prostheses
summary: After undergoing a mastectomy, a woman in central Kenya has found purpose through knitting and community support.

title: Gustav Klimt portrait breaks modern art record with $236m sale
summary: The painting helped save the life of its Jewish subject from Nazis during World War II.

title: US raises reward for ex-Olympian turned drug lord, as 7 arrested in Canada
summary: FBI Director Kash Patel described Canadian former snowboarder Ryan Wedding as a 'modern-day iteration of Pablo Escobar'.

title: India wants COP30 to focus on climate adaptation, but dries up own fund
summary: The Indian government has been allocating zero budget for a flagship climate adaptation scheme for the past two years.

title: Après une journée meurtrière à Gaza, Israël et le Hamas s'accusent de violer la trêve
summary: Au moins 27 personnes ont péri mercredi dans des frappes israéliennes sur la bande de Gaza, l'un des bilans les plus lourds depuis l'entrée en vigueur de la trêve le 10 octobre. Israël et le Hamas se rejettent la faute.

title: Benjamin Netanyahu se rend sur le plateau du Golan syrien et provoque la colère de Damas
summary: Le Premier ministre israélien, Benjamin Netanyahu, s'est rendu, mercredi, auprès des troupes déployées en Syrie, de l'autre côté de la ligne de démarcation entre les deux pays toujours en guerre. De son côté, Damas a dénoncé une "violation" de sa souveraineté, accusant Israël d'empiéter sur une zone tampon censée séparer les forces des deux États.

title: Liban : l'armée israélienne annonce des frappes contre le Hezbollah
summary: Après avoir émis des ordres d'évacuation, Israël a frappé, mercredi après-midi, le sud du Liban, selon l'armée, qui affirme avoir visé des sites militaires du Hezbollah.

title: Arabie Saoudite: premier partenaire de Trump ?
summary: En accueillant avec tous les honneurs le prince héritier Mohamed Ben Salmane à Washington, Donald Trump montre à quel point l'Arabie Saoudite est un allié stratégique pour lui au Porche-Orient. Plus encore qu'Israël ? On va plus loin avec Patricia Allémonière et Bruno Daroux.

title: Des dizaines de morts dans un camp de réfugiés au sud du Liban
summary: Une frappe israélienne a touché un camp de réfugiés palestiniens à Saïda, dans le sud du Liban. Les secours font état de dizaines de morts et de nombreux blessés, un bilan amené à évoluer. "C'est la deuxième fois, depuis le 7 octobre 2023, que le camp d'Aïn al-Héloué est directement touché par l'armée israélienne, ce camp abritant plusieurs factions palestiniennes, dont des groupes affiliés au Hamas", explique le correspondant de France 24 à Beyrouth, Serge Berberi.

title: Au Liban, au moins 13 morts dans une frappe israélienne sur un camp de réfugiés palestiniens
summary: Une frappe israélienne ayant visé la ville de Saïda, dans le sud du Liban, a fait au moins 13 morts mardi, selon le ministère libanais de la Santé. Tsahal défend avoir visé un camp d'entraînement du Hamas, quand le mouvement islamiste dénonce une "attaque barbare" contre un camp de réfugiés palestiniens.

title: Cisjordanie occupée : un mort et trois blessés dans une attaque près de colonies israéliennes
summary: Le Magen David Adom, l'équivalent israélien de la Croix-Rouge, a annoncé, mardi, la mort d'un homme d'une trentaine d’années après une attaque à la voiture-bélier et au couteau survenue dans le sud de la Cisjordanie occupée, près de colonies israéliennes. L'organisation précise avoir évacué trois autres personnes vers des hôpitaux de Jérusalem.

title: Famine à Gaza : "Les répercussions se feront sentir pendant des générations"
summary: Une organisation spécialisée dans la sécurité alimentaire a officiellement déclaré l'état de famine catastrophique à Gaza en début d'année. Bien que l'aide commence à parvenir au compte-gouttes à l'enclave palestinienne, les experts estiment que la famine pourrait bouleverser Gaza sur des générations.

title: En Syrie, le premier procès sur les massacres de mars 2025 s'est ouvert
summary: Le premier procès consacré aux massacres de mars 2025 en Syrie a débuté, mardi, à Alep, dans le nord du pays. Sept hommes, dont d'anciens militaires, accusés d'avoir attaqué les troupes gouvernementales, et sept membres des forces relevant des nouvelles autorités islamistes, ont comparu devant les juges.

title: Le plan de paix de Trump adopté par le Conseil de sécurité de l'ONU
summary: C'est un texte d'une grande importance qui a été adoptée par treize voix au Conseil de sécurité de l'ONU. La résolution offre un cadre juridique international à l'action américaine, permettant de maintenir le cessez-le-feu et facilitant la distribution d'aide humanitaire. "Une suite logique", selon l'ambassadeur américain, l'autorité palestinienne ayant notamment donné son accord, rapporte la correspondante à New York, Émilie Musset, qui estime que "des zones d'ombre" persistent dans le texte.

title: Le Conseil de sécurité de l'ONU vote en faveur du déploiement d'une force internationale à Gaza
summary: Le Conseil de sécurité de l'ONU a adopté, lundi, une résolution américaine prévoyant notamment la mise en place d'une force internationale dans la bande de Gaza. Un vote salué par Donald Trump et immédiatement rejeté par le Hamas qui estime que le texte "ne répond pas aux exigences" des Palestiniens.

title: Cisjordanie occupée : Netanyahu dénonce les violences "d'une poignée d'extrémistes" israéliens
summary: Le Premier ministre israélien, Benjamin Netanyahu, a dénoncé, lundi soir, les violences d'une "poignée d'extrémistes" non représentative, selon lui, des colons qui vivent en Cisjordanie occupée. Cette déclaration intervient après une nouvelle attaque contre un village palestinien.

title: Barrages de la Coupe du monde 2026 : Kosovo -Bosnie-Herzégovine, le match interdit pour raisons politiques
summary: Vingt-deux nations vont se disputer, en mars, les six dernières places pour le prochain Mondial. Le tirage au sort des barrages se déroule jeudi à Zurich (Suisse), à partir de 13 heures, avec pour seule certitude le fait que ces deux sélections des Balkans ne se rencontreront pas.

title: Report par l’UE de la loi contre la déforestation : les ONG dénoncent un symbole « terrible » en pleine « COP de l’Amazonie »
summary: Le vote du Conseil de l’Union européenne, qui doit désormais être discuté au Parlement, est une défaite pour la France, qui s’opposait à un nouveau décalage de l’entrée en vigueur de ce dispositif.

title: Guerre en Ukraine : Russes et Américains négocient de nouveau dans le dos des Européens
summary: Alors que Volodymyr Zelensky est fragilisé par un scandale de corruption dans son entourage, la Maison Blanche et le Kremlin lui ont transmis un plan faisant la part belle aux exigences russes sur la fin de la guerre et la sécurité du continent.

title: EN DIRECT, Gaza : plus de 10 000 enfants ont été vaccinés depuis le 9 novembre, annonce l’OMS
summary: Au moins 27 personnes sont mortes mercredi dans des frappes israéliennes, selon un bilan de la défense civile de l’enclave palestinienne. L’armée a affirmé avoir riposté à « des terroristes ».

title: Une ONG alerte sur le lourd bilan des armes explosives sur les enfants en zone de guerre
summary: Quelque 11 967 enfants ont été tués ou blessés en 2024 dans des zones de conflit ; 70 % d’entre eux l’ont été par des bombes aériennes ou des mines, relève l’ONG Save the Children. Les guerres à Gaza, au Soudan et en Ukraine sont parmi les plus meurtrières pour les plus jeunes.

title: L’Assemblée nationale adopte la taxe sur les « petits colis » d’origine extra-européenne
summary: Visant à limiter la concurrence des produits chinois, la taxe de 2 euros ciblant les colis d’une valeur inférieure à 150 euros a été approuvée malgré de vifs débats.

title: Faillite de Northvolt : la chute du symbole de la « réindustrialisation verte » en Suède
summary: Le 12 mars, le géant des batteries électriques mettait la clé sous la porte. Près de 5 000 personnes employées dans la gigafactory de Skelleftea ont perdu leur emploi. Alors que l’américain Lyten se prépare à relancer la production, la débâcle de Northvolt a jeté un froid dans la réindustrialisation du pays.

title: Pourquoi la mort de Franco divise-t-elle toujours les Espagnols ? Comprendre en trois minutes
summary: Cinquante ans après sa mort, le 20 novembre 1975, la figure de Francisco Franco continue de susciter le débat en Espagne. Un cycle de commémorations célébrant l’avènement de la démocratie a été organisé par le gouvernement socialiste de Pedro Sanchez. Pendant ce temps, extrême droite et nostalgiques défilent dans les rues en l’honneur de l’ancien dictateur.

title: VIDÉO 80 ans du procès de Nuremberg : le rôle des images, au cœur de l’événement
summary: En 1945, juste après la seconde guerre mondiale, les Alliés organisent un procès pour juger les dignitaires nazis. Une grande partie de l’événement est filmée et de nombreuses images des atrocités nazies sont projetées pendant les audiences. C’est le choc.

title: « Le procès de Nuremberg est un moment fondateur qui met fin à l’impunité des chefs d’Etat »
summary: Le 20 novembre 1945 commençait, dans cette ville du sud de l’Allemagne, le procès historique d’une vingtaine de hauts dignitaires nazis. Dans un entretien au « Monde », l’historienne Sylvie Lindeperg rappelle en quoi il a constitué un jalon majeur pour la justice internationale.

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : l’Ukraine a reçu une nouvelle proposition des Etats-Unis pour mettre fin au conflit
summary: Alors que des frappes russes meurtrières ont touché l’ouest du pays ces derniers jours, la proposition américaine requiert notamment que Kiev cède des territoires à la Russie et réduise son armée de moitié, selon des déclarations à l’AFP d’un haut responsable ukrainien sous couvert d’anonymat.

title: Après neuf mois d’opérations militaires israéliennes, les camps de réfugiés du nord de la Cisjordanie devenus « inhabitables »
summary: Les destructions de bâtiments, de canalisations et du système électrique par l’armée israélienne rendent impossible un retour à une vie quotidienne normale pour les 30 000 Palestiniens déplacés de force.

title: Hamas says Israel manipulating prisoner lists, seeks to resume Gaza genocide
summary:
Hamas says Israel manipulating prisoner lists, seeks to resume Gaza genocide

Islamic Resistance Movement Hamas on Thursday said that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is seeking to resume genocide in Gaza, as Israeli forces killed at least 28 Palestinians on Wednesday. 

Hamas's media officer at the Martyrs and Prisoners Office, Nahed Al-Fakhoury, also said that Israel is manipulating the file of forcibly disappeared prisoners. 

Fakhoury said the delay in announcing the list of prisoners was a deliberate move to create division. 

Israel stipulated that it should hand over a list of the names of the prisoners it was holding in the early days of the agreement, but later stalled this and manipulated a number of names, Fakhoury told Al Jazeera. 

He said that Israel acknowledged the existence of prisoners in its possession, and then retracted them, without providing clear answers regarding the retraction.

He added that there are 11 detainees whose presence Israel now denies, had met with released prisoners, and one had recently been visited by a lawyer.

title: Gaza officials say three children killed in Israeli bombing of Khan Younis building
summary:
Gaza officials say three children killed in Israeli bombing of Khan Younis building

Gaza's civil defence ambulance services reported that the bodies of three children were recovered on Thursday following Israeli bombing of a residential building in the town of Bani Suheila, east of Khan Yunis, in the southern Gaza Strip.

Earlier, it was reported that Israeli forces killed three Palestinians by bombing a house in Bani Suheila area, but details on the incident were unclear.

title: Gaza hospital says child killed in overnight Israeli bombing
summary:
Gaza hospital says child killed in overnight Israeli bombing

The body of a child killed in overnight Israeli bombing of Gaza City was recovered on Thursday, Al Jazeera Arabic reported, quoting the Baptist Hospital. 

On Wednesday, 28 Palestinians were killed in Israeli air strikes, Gaza’s health ministry said.

At least 305 Palestinians have been killed since the US-brokered ceasefire came into effect, Reuters reported on Wednesday.

Nearly half of those were killed in a single day last week, according to Palestinian health authorities.

The death toll in Gaza since Israel's genocide began in October 2023 has risen to 69,513, the Palestinian health ministry said.

title: Israeli forces raid National Hospital courtyard in occupied West Bank
summary:
Israeli forces raid National Hospital courtyard in occupied West Bank

Israeli forces on Thursday raided the National Hospital courtyard and stormed the Al-Hajj Nimr Mosque in the city of Nablus in the northern occupied West Bank, Al Jazeera Arabic reported. 

The report said that the occupation forces have been continuing their raids and arrests in the city of Nablus for more than 6 hours

title: Israeli air strikes hit eastern Rafah as drone fire kills one in Khan Younis
summary:
Israeli air strikes hit eastern Rafah as drone fire kills one in Khan Younis

Israeli aircraft on Thursday launched air strikes on the eastern areas of Rafah city in the southern Gaza Strip, local media have reported. 

Al Jazeera reported artillery shelling and gunfire from Israeli helicopters towards the town of Abasan, east of Khan Yunis, behind the yellow line.

At least one Palestinian was reportedly killed in Israeli drone fire in the town of Abasan al-Kabira, east of Khan Younis, Nasser Medical Complex said.

title: HRW: Israel carrying out forced displacement in occupied West Bank
summary:
HRW: Israel carrying out forced displacement in occupied West Bank

Human Rights Watch (HRW) on Thursday said that Israel has been carrying out the forced displacement of residents of three camps in the occupied West Bank since January 2025. 

"Israel's forced displacement of residents from three refugee camps in the West Bank amounts to war crimes and crimes against humanity," HRW said. 

Hundreds of homes in the Jenin, Tulkarm and Nur Shams camps were damaged by Israeli attacks.

"We call for an investigation into Netanyahu, Smotrich, and Gallant regarding the displacement and expulsion operations from the camps," it added.

title: Israeli forces besiege West Bank hospital, raid shops and seize camera footage
summary:
Israeli forces besiege West Bank hospital, raid shops and seize camera footage

Israeli forces on Thursday continued the siege of the National Hospital in Nablus city in the northern occupied West Bank, as the military prevented vehicles from passing through Faisal Street, Al Jazeera Arabic reported. 

The report said that the occupation forces also carried out raids on a number of shops and confiscated surveillance camera recordings

title: Israeli forces kill three Palestinians by bombing house in Gaza's Khan Younis
summary:
Israeli forces kill three Palestinians by bombing house in Gaza's Khan Younis

Israeli forces on Thursday killed three Palestinians by bombing a house in Bani Suheila area, east of Khan Younis, Gaza's civil defence agency said. 

On Wednesday, 28 Palestinians were killed in Israeli air strikes, Gaza’s health ministry said.

At least 305 Palestinians have been killed since the US-brokered ceasefire came into effect, Reuters reported on Wednesday.

Nearly half of those were killed in a single day last week, according to Palestinian health authorities.

The death toll in Gaza since Israel's genocide began in October 2023 has risen to 69,513, the Palestinian health ministry said.

title: Israeli forces make mass arrests near Hebron, target relatives of slain Palestinian
summary:
Israeli forces make mass arrests near Hebron, target relatives of slain Palestinian

Israeli military detained more than 40 Palestinians in Beit Ummar, north of Hebron in the occupied West Bank, as the forces continue to raid homes since Wednesday morning, Al Jazeera reported. 

Israeli forces also stormed the homes of relatives of Imran al-Atrash in Hebron and arrested a number of them. Al-Atrash was killed by Israeli fire near Bethlehem in the southern West Bank.

Israel said he was one of the perpetrators of the car-ramming and stabbing attack at the Gush Etzion junction in the southern West Bank on Tuesday.

title: Israel receives 1,000th military cargo plane in US-backed weapons air bridge
summary:
Israel receives 1,000th military cargo plane in US-backed weapons air bridge

The Israeli ministry of defence on Thursday said that the 1,000th cargo plane arrived at the Ben Gurion Airport as part of the air bridge that has been ongoing since 7 October 2023 to support the country with military equipment.

Israeli army led transcontinental logistical transfers of an unprecedented scale in Israel’s history, with the aim of supporting all the current and future military needs, the ministry said. 

"So far, more than 120,000 tons of military equipment, ammunition, combat equipment, and protective gear have been brought in via 1,000 aircraft and about 150 ships," it said. 

The ministry said that these operations are the result of cooperation with the United States and Germany, through which advanced ammunition, weapons, armoured vehicles, medical equipment, communication systems, and personal protection equipment were purchased and transferred.

title: Morning update
summary:
Morning update

Good morning Middle East Eye readers,

Here are the major developments from Israel’s genocidal war on Gaza:

  • Human Rights Watch said that Israel has imposed forced displacement on residents of refugee camps in the West Bank, where hundreds of homes were damaged by Israeli attacks, calling it a war crime. 

  • Israeli forces continue to storm cities and towns across the West Bank, including Nablus, Beita, Beit Furik and Awarta, amid a widespread campaign of raids and arrests.

  • Palestinian Mujahideen Movement condemned the "brutal massacre committed by the Zionist enemy against civilians" in the cities of Gaza and Khan Yunis. 

  • Unrwa Commissioner-General Philippe Lazzarini said that crossings into Gaza must be opened to deliver aid as winter "adds another hardship" to the residents. 

  • Israeli military arrested 40 Palestinians in Beit Ummar, Hebron in the West Bank, as the forces continue to raid homes since Wednesday morning.

title: After almost 60 years in their homes, Jerusalem families given demolition orders
summary:
After almost 60 years in their homes, Jerusalem families given demolition orders

Israeli authorities have given demolition orders to four Palestinian families in Jerusalem’s Old City on Wednesday, even though the families have lived there for almost six decades, Wafa news agency reported.

The Israeli authorities apparently told the families the homes are unfit to live in. 

The Hashima, Maswadeh, Kastero, and Sidaawi families, who were given the demolition orders, are said to be shocked by the orders as they have been refused permits to repair or upgrade their homes.,They have also been prevented them from carrying out essential maintenance, leading to deterioration of the structures. 

The families said they will legally challenge the orders which will leave dozens of family members homeless. 

The orders come are part of  broader efforts by the Israeli government to depopulate Palestinians from the Old City.

Past president of Hebrew University weathered COVID, judicial reform and a massive call-up of student reservists post-Oct. 7. Shunning of Israeli institutions a larger challenge

title: Canada’s resolution against Iran ‘politically motivated,’ says deputy UN envoy
summary: New York, IRNA - Iran’s deputy representative to the United Nations, Gholamhossein Darzi, has voiced strong opposition to a resolution introduced by Canada on human rights in Iran, calling it politically motivated and counterproductive.

title: Iran condemns deadly Israeli strike on refugee camp in southern Lebanon
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iran has strongly condemned an Israeli attack on a Palestinian refugee camp in southern Lebanon, which killed at least 13 civilians.

title: Iran rejects any attempt to impose ‘external agendas’ in Syria: UN envoy
summary: New York, IRNA - Iran’s Ambassador and Permanent Representative to the United Nations says Tehran firmly rejects any attempt to impose external agendas in Syria, including schemes for “fragmentation, forced demographic change, or the establishment of illegitimate autonomous zones.”

title: ‘Sanctimonious drivel’: Iran’s UN mission denounces Canada’s human rights resolution
summary: New York, IRNA - The Permanent Mission of the Islamic Republic of Iran to the United Nations has issued a strong rebuttal to human rights allegations raised by Canada following the adoption of a resolution against Iran at the UN General Assembly.

title: Araghchi discusses bilateral ties with Brazilian counterpart
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Mnister Abbas Araghchi in a telephone conversation with his Brazilian counterpart, Mauro Vieira, discussed bilateral ties and international developments.

title: Iran sees ‘positive’ trend in foreign tourism: Minister
summary: Zanjan, IRNA – Minister of Cultural Heritage, Tourism, and Handicrafts Reza Salehi-Amiri says the number of foreign tourists in Iran over the past two months has been positive.

title: Hezbollah strongly condemns deadly Israeli strike on Lebanon’s refugee camp
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Lebanon’s Hezbollah resistance movement has strongly condemned the deadly Israeli attack on the Ain Al-Hilweh refugee camp in Sidon, Lebanon.

title: Saravi and Hedayati lead Iran to double Greco-Roman gold at Islamic Solidarity Games
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iran celebrated a double triumph at the Islamic Solidarity Games in Riyadh on Wednesday, as Olympic champion Mohammad Hadi Saravi and heavyweight contender Fardin Hedayati each captured Greco-Roman wrestling gold medals to extend the nation’s dominance on the mat.

title: Lebanon’s Berri calls for urgent UN Security Council meeting over Israeli violations
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Lebanon’s Parliament Speaker Nabih Berri has urged the government to file another complaint with the UN Security Council and called for an emergency council meeting over continued Israeli attacks on civilians in southern Lebanon.

title: Iran’s new ambassador to Bangladesh meets with FM Araghchi
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iran’s new ambassador to Bangladesh, Jalil Rahimi-Jahanabadi, has held a meeting with Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi.

title: Private sector should not wait for administration to remove all obstacles: Chamber chief
summary: Rasht, IRNA – The head of Iran’s Chamber of Commerce, Industries, Mines and Agriculture says the country’s private sector must take a more proactive role in shaping Iran’s economic future, stressing that the private sector should not wait for the administration to remove all obstacles.

title: IAEA chief confirms inspection of Iran’s nuclear sites ‘unaffected’ by June attacks
summary: London, IRNA – Director General of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) Rafael Grossi has confirmed the resumption of normal monitoring at Iran’s nuclear facilities that were not damaged during the unprovoked Israeli-US attacks in June.

title: Iran strongly condemns Israel's aggression in S. Lebanon
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 20 (MNA) – Foreign Ministry spokesman Esmaeil Baghaei has strongly condemned the Zionist Israeli regime after the airstrikes on the Ain Al-Hilweh camp in Sidon and the city of Sidon.

title: Human Rights Watch accuses Israel of war crimes in West Bank
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 20 (MNA) – Israel’s expulsion of tens of thousands of Palestinians from three West Bank refugee camps in early 2025 amounts to war crimes and crimes against humanity, Human Rights Watch said on Thursday.

title: Trump orders Justice Dep. to release Epstein file
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 20 (MNA) – US President Donald Trump announced on Wednesday that he signed a bill ordering the release of all files related to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Iran responds to Canada's hostile allegations on human rights
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 20 (MNA) – The Islamic Republic of Iran's mission to the United Nations has responded to the anti-Iran human rights allegations levelled by the Canadian mission, describing the claims as "an act of self-expression."

title: Fire engulfs Venezuela’s Petrocedeno oil upgrader
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 20 (MNA) – A massive explosion and fire tore through Venezuela’s Petrocedeno oil upgrader in Anzoátegui state, sending thick clouds of smoke over the facility and forcing emergency evacuations.

title: Araghchi calls on IAEA BoG to oppose E3 illegal actions
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 20 (MNA) – Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has called on all member states of the IAEA Board of Governors to oppose the illegal action by the three European countries against the Islamic Republic of Iran.

title: Iran, Russia friendly, brotherly neighbors in region
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 20 (MNA) – Iran and Russia are “friendly and brotherly neighboring countries in the region,” and that culture serves as a “bridge of connectivity between the two nations, Chargé d’affaires of the Russian Embassy in Tehran emphasized.

title: Secret behind UNSC Gaza resolution controversy
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 20 (MNA) – Here are controversial points raised by Security Council Resolution 2803/2025 issued on Monday regarding Gaza, which adopts the US vision for the administration of Gaza after the Sharm El-Sheikh Agreement on October 13, 2025.

title: Trump’s defense of MBS over Khashoggi murder draws outrage
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 19 (MNA) – The meeting between US President Donald Trump and Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman (MBS)Tuesday was overshadowed by the 2018 murder of dissident Saudi-American journalist Jamal Khashoggi.

title: Iran not to engage with IAEA on bombed nuclear facilities
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 19 (MNA) – Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi says that his country will not engage with the International Atomic Energy Agency about its bombed nuclear facilities.

title: Mehr News Agency interview with Japan's ambassador
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 19 (MNA) – Mehr News Agency’s correspondents sat for an interview with Japanese Ambassador to Tehran, Tamaki Tsukada, on Wednesday.

title: Istanbul talks on Ukraine should be revived: Erdogan
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 19 (MNA) – The Russia-Ukraine Istanbul talks should be revived, said Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan in an announcement made after his meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Wednesday.

title: زمان‌شناسی علامه بهابادی او را به چهره‌ای اثرگذار در تشیع بدل کرد
summary: شیراز-تولیت حرم شاهچراغ(ع)با بیان اینکه زمان‌شناسی علامه بهابادی او را به چهره‌ای اثرگذار در تشیع بدل کرد،گفت: این عالم ربانی نمونه‌ای موفق از درک صحیح از شرایط سیاسی و اجتماعی عصر خود است.

title: ۳۰ میلیارد تومان اعتبار برای مرمت گنبد تاریخی سلطانیه اختصاص یافت
summary: زنجان- وزیر میراث فرهنگی، گردشگری و صنایع‌دستی از آغاز مرحله جدید مرمت و احیای این اثر جهانی خبر داد و گفت: ۳۰ میلیارد تومان اعتبار برای مرمت گنبد تاریخی سلطانیه اختصاص یافت.

title: سردار حسینی: ۶۶ برنامه طی هفته بسیج در ایلام برگزار می شود
summary: ایلام - فرمانده سپاه امیرالمؤمنین استان ایلام گفت: ۶۶ برنامه طی هفته بسیج در ایلام توسط سپاه امیرالمؤمنین استان برگزار می شود.

title: قاضی ویژه برای افزایش سرعت ترخیص واگن‌های مترو و اتوبوس تعیین شد
summary: بندرعباس- رئیس کل دادگستری هرمزگان از تعیین قاضی ویژه و شرایط خاص برای سهولت و سرعت ترخیص یک‌هزار واگن مترو، ۲۵۰۰ دستگاه اتوبوس برقی و بیش از ۲۷ هزار و ۵۰۰ دستگاه تاکسی برقی خبر داد.

title: ابوترابی: خانواده اساس و رکن جامعه به‌ویژه در فرهنگ ایرانی اسلامی است
summary: مشهد- مدیرکل آموزش‌های تخصصی سازمان تبلیغات اسلامی خانواده را اساس و رکن جامعه به‌ویژه در فرهنگ ایرانی-اسلامی برشمرد و گفت: دشمنان برای این نهاد برنامه‌ریزی کرده و قصد تضعیف آن را دارند.

title: کارخانه خون‌سازی مغز استخوان انسان در آزمایشگاه ساخته شد
summary: محققان برای نخستین بار در حوزه مهندسی زیستی به طور موفقیت آمیز یک مدل واقع گرایانه از مغز استخوان انسان را با سلول های انسان ساخته اند.
